comments:
Well, this is rich. We've fixed a bug that involved ']]>'
and including that character sequence in the bug abstract has now 
exposed a bug in our "whatisfixed" program! 

I've marked as "blocking" because I *think* this always leads to this "out of memory" error. Not sure why that would be related, but have seen it frequently today.

FYI, I changed the abstract in bug 136579 to say ']]>' instead of ']]>', 
so, if that fixes the build problem, this bug's severity can be reduced to 'normal'.

The bug is Cool :-)  

The uncool part is  what is fixed program uses apache xmlbeans to serialize the info to the xml file. Looking at if there is an easy fix such as "encode strings" option.

(In reply to comment #2)
> The bug is Cool :-)  
> 
> The uncool part is  what is fixed program uses apache xmlbeans to serialize the
> info to the xml file. Looking at if there is an easy fix such as "encode
> strings" option. 

I think it's still cool since bug 135245, the bug that broke the what is fixed program, is all about serializing "]]>" safely into an XML file.

Thanks Naci .. I didnt' literally test by changing to old abstract back :( 
but will mark as fixed, and we can test when we really want to have some fun :)
